alert.note: Alert for Wake (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 09 at 3:22PM EDT until July 09 at 4:45PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 445 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON FOR WAKE COUNTY... At 322 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated only light rain remains where thunderstorms produced heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Despite improving conditions in urban areas, creeks and streams continue to rise due to runoff. HAZARD...Flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Raleigh, Durham, Cary, Wake Forest, Garner, Fuquay-Varina, Zebulon, RDU International, Apex, Holly Springs, Morrisville, Knightdale, Wendell, Rolesville, Lake Wheeler, Lake Benson, William B Umstead State Park, Falls Lake Boat Ramp, Research Triangle and Carpenter. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe. Stay away or be swept away. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
